comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: Just to give you some background information. This is in a drawer alongside photos documenting a steamship leaving for Europe, presumably from New York and this may be an island (Fort Lafayette?) in the harbor. In a letter dated July 8, 1900, Goodyear describes his booking on a ship leaving NY on July 14th, landing at Charbourg and then on to Paris. [W.H. Goodyear Collection Dept. of Fine Arts [3.1.007]] This image is part of the Paris Exposition group of slides and may possibly be a record of his travel to the exposition. We’ll use the information to update our catalog record. Fort Lafayette was used as a prison during the Civil War and transformed into a munitions store before being demolished around 1962, and the site used as the foundation for the Brooklyn side tower of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.
